intro: Milligania stylosa, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Milligania stylosa is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
